'Isoprenaline' (INN) or 'isoproterenol' (USAN, trade names 'Medihaler-Iso' and
'Isuprel') is a medication used for the treatment of bradycardia (slow heart
rate), heart block, and rarely for asthma. It is a non-selective beta-adrenergic
agonist and structurally similar to adrenaline.
